title: Edwards Aquifer Habitat Conservation Plan Spring 2026 Science Research Meeting
text:
April 15, 2026 · Texas State University - LBJ · San Marcos, TX
Please join us for the Spring 2026 EAHCP Science Research Meeting. The meeting will be held April, 15 2026 at the LBJ student center in room 313. please rsvp to so and so and see our flyer below. We hope to see you there! HCP team. lorem ipsumm. Please join us for the Spring 2026 EAHCP Science Research Meeting. The meeting will be held April, 15 2026 at the LBJ student center in room 313. please rsvp to so and so and see our flyer below. We hope to see you there! HCP team. lorem ipsumm

title: Edwards Aquifer Habitat Conservation Plan Spring 2026 Science Research Meeting
text:
Program

Symposium Program

Tentative schedule
Morning

9:00 – 10:00 AM · State of the Biological and Hydrological Systems
Short overview talks from EAA staff and partners.
10:00 – 10:30 AM · Coffee Break
10:30 AM – 12:00 PM · Parallel Sessions

Track A – Hydrology
Extreme events, recharge, and long-term trends.

Track B – Eurycea
Salamander ecology, genetics, and monitoring.


Lunch

12:00 – 1:00 PM · Lunch & Networking
Box lunches provided; poster browsing encouraged.

Afternoon

1:00 – 2:30 PM · Parallel Sessions

Track A – Data Streams
Radar, springflow, portals, and data tools.

Track B – TBD
(Restoration, vegetation, darters, macroinvertebrates, etc.)

2:30 – 3:00 PM · EAHCP Science Committee Business Meeting
3:00 PM · Adjourn


Note: Final program with talk titles and times will be posted here once confirmed.

title: Edwards Aquifer Habitat Conservation Plan Spring 2026 Science Research Meeting
text:
Speakers & Abstracts

Invited Speakers & Abstracts



Dr. Håkan Something
Hydrologist, University / Agency
Talk: Floods, Recharge, and “Flash Flood Alley”
Abstract:
Short 2–3 paragraph abstract here. Summarize objectives, methods, and key findings.


Dr. Chakraborty
Institution
Talk: Long-term Aquifer Dynamics Under Climate Variability
Abstract:
Another placeholder abstract block. You can paste full abstracts here, or link to a PDF if they’re long.


Chad Furl
Edwards Aquifer Authority
Talk: New Data Tools for Rainfall and Recharge
Abstract:
Brief description of your radar / data work, as long as you like.



Suggestion: For 20+ talks, we can switch to collapsible accordions by session instead of cards to avoid a mega-scroll. When you have the full list, send it and I’ll re-format this section.

title: Edwards Aquifer Habitat Conservation Plan Spring 2026 Science Research Meeting
text:
Logistics

Logistics & Venue

Venue

Building: [Building Name], Texas State University

Address: Street Address, San Marcos, TX 78666

Check-in

Check-in opens at 8:15 AM in the lobby outside the main auditorium.
Name badges and programs will be available at the registration table.

Wi-Fi

Network: TSU-Guest

Instructions: Follow on-screen prompts; no account required.

Meals & Coffee

Coffee and light refreshments provided during the morning break.
Lunch is provided for all registered participants (please indicate dietary needs in advance).

Date & Time April 15, 2026 · 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM


Location LBJ Student Center, Room 323 Texas State University · San Marcos, Texas


Check-in Check-in and name badges available outside Room 323 starting at 8:30 AM.


Food & breaks Morning and afternoon coffee breaks are provided. Lunch is provided for all registered attendees.


Parking Additional parking details will be provided prior to the event.
